result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte D Meeks Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.
Civil filing fee of $204.50 pursuant to sec 814.61(1)(d) & (e) & service fee pursuant to sec 814.70(1) from case 18CV3133 remitted.
$250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days. Court authorized payment plan.

Bail/bond hearing on June 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Branch 14

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Laura Breun.  Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests ct find cts 2 and 3 transactionally related. No objection. Ct so finds. State requests Court take judicial notice of cases 20CF2939, 21CF528, 21CF666, 21CF732, 21CF1261 and that DE was out on bail. Ct takes judicial notice. Officer M.O. duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA Hess. DE identified. Cross. Witness excused. State moves for b/o, reserves rebuttal argument. Argument by Attorney Breun. Court finds PC felony was probably committed by DE and binds case over.
Zoom
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Preliminary hearing on June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $3,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Dominique B. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence, place of employment, or other place where Dominique B is present. 
- Defendant shall not be within 1000 feet of Dominique B. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 14

01:54 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Amy M Johnson.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
